page.title: 06Local History 3 - Yardley
page.content: The Trust School The inscription on the front of the former Trust School reads,"By A.D 1260 there is evidence of a school in Yardley.The masters were monks from Maxstoke priory.This present building probably dates from the 15th century.It may have originally have been the Guild Hall.W.Sutherns was the last master.The school closed in 1908.It is now used as Parish rooms with a Youth Club upstairs, the Sarah Hassell Lounge downstairs. The bracket for the school bell still remains in the gable.The School closed in 1908 when the local authority,Worcestershire County council,built a new school near the Yew Tree.Built on to the timber framed block,are early 19th century additions,built for the schoolmaster. Schoolmaster James Chell's gravestone remains in the churchyard.
